column4: hey i typed gconftools-2 and things went all CLI for osme reason
how can i make it back to normal, so wen i type "gconftools" it pop up the configuration editor?
gconf-editor is what you are looking for
thanks.. was confused
i want to copy a file over a folder.. however i dont have perimisssion.. wat to do under GUI..
what are you trying to delete?
nothing just adding a splash.png
why would that require copying a file over a folder?
i think its locked under a directory.....
!splash | OrangeOrange
yea i know... but i think its locked under this directory (keyname) "apps/gnome-session/options/splash_image"
what do you mean "locked"?
or i type my dir wrong?
if i edit my splash key
name is grey uneditable only value is editable i put in /home/jason/splash.png... doesnt work.. used the other splashes
other default splash
does the key value now say /home/jason/slash.png?
yes
so..
ok, so name your splash.png to jason.png and copy it to /usr/share/pixmaps/splash/  then cahnge the key value to splash/jason.png
so im correct :> its locked
I don't know what you mean by "locked".  But the key's description explains the path is a relative one
